channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Britain's motor finance industry is in crisis – with banks bracing for billions in payouts
item.description: The crisis has prompted comparisons to Britain's PPI scandal, which was estimated to have cost banks more than £50 billion ($63.8 billion).

item.title: Here's what the U.S.' enemies — and allies — might see from Marco Rubio as secretary of state
item.description: Sen. Marco Rubio's nomination as secretary of state will see him become the world's most important diplomat.

item.title: Smart ring leader Oura plans international push as CEO touts new features and thinking on hardware
item.description: Oura CEO Tom Hale spoke to CNBC about the smart ring product category and the impact of Samsung's entrance into the space.

item.title: Tech giants are investing in 'sovereign AI' to help Europe cut its dependence on the U.S.
item.description: Tech giants are investing in the development of "sovereign" AI models in Europe to reduce the region's dependence on largely U.S.-controlled infrastructure.

item.title: Trump victory drives gold to near 2-month lows as investors pile into equities, cryptocurrencies
item.description: The recent slide — gold has declined in six of the seven sessions since Trump's victory — follows a series of record-breaking milestones for bullion over the past year.

item.title: Chinese AI startup takes aim at OpenAI's Sora with image-to-video tool launch
item.description: Beijing-based Shengshu Technology updated its artificial intelligence-powered text-to-video tool Vidu for generating videos based on separate images.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: 'Higher for longer' rates could rear its head once again
item.description: With Trump's policies looking inflationary, could the Fed's easing path be derailed by rising inflation?

item.title: The season's hottest gift? A travel 'experience' — here's how to buy one
item.description: Travel is hard to give to others, according to a new Accenture survey. CNBC Travel explores several ways to get around the hardest problems.

item.title: Trump victory may provide TikTok a lifeline to remain in the U.S.
item.description: Donald Trump's election victory may provide a lifeline for TikTok, which faces a potential U.S. ban in January if not divested from parent company ByteDance.

item.title: A Singaporean AI startup is trying to disrupt the 100-year-old market research industry
item.description: Singapore startup Ai Palette is upending the 100-year-old market research industry using its powerful technology

item.title: Oil could plunge to $40 in 2025 if OPEC unwinds voluntary production cuts, analysts say
item.description: Many market watchers predicted a bearish year ahead for crude.

item.title: Japan is ramping up efforts to revive its once dominant chip industry
item.description: Japan has announced its latest plan to boost the country's chip and AI industries as it works to regain its leading position in semiconductor technology.

item.title: AMD to lay off 4% of workforce, or about 1,000 employees
item.description: At the end of last year, AMD had 26,000 employees, according to a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filing.

item.title: David Einhorn is building new position in CNH Industrial, says agricultural play is 'cheap'
item.description: The hedge fund investor said the agricultural machinery company is an under-the-radar value play as the industry nears the end of a bearish cycle.

item.title: Tesla initiates sixth Cybertruck recall in a year
item.description: Tesla is voluntarily recalling 2,431 Cybertrucks to replace defective drive inverters, according to a filing with the National Highway Traffic Administration.

item.title: Bitcoin briefly tops $93,000 for the first time as investors digest postelection gains, inflation data
item.description: Bitcoin rose above $93,000 following slightly higher October inflation data Wednesday.

item.title: Amazon Prime Video to stream Diamond regional sports networks
item.description: The newly rebranded FanDuel Sports Network will be available as an add-on subscription for Prime customers living within the team's designated geographic area.

item.title: Trump picks Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general
item.description: Donald Trump loyalist Matt Gaetz offered his resignation from Congress the same day he was tapped to be U.S. attorney general, House Speaker Mike Johnson said.

item.title: Here's the inflation breakdown for October 2024 — in one chart
item.description: Consumers saw price relief at the gas pump and grocery store. But housing inflation and other categories, such as car insurance, are trouble spots.

item.title: Buy now, pay later provider Klarna says it filed confidentially for U.S. IPO
item.description: Klarna, which is known for its popular buy now, pay later business, has confidentially filed IPO documents with the U.S. SEC.

item.title: Saudi Arabia's Neom replaces its CEO amid reports of delays and cutbacks
item.description: Neom is set to host hyper-futuristic cityscapes and structures — but financial pressures on the kingdom are changing.

item.title: John Thune elected Senate majority leader
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump did not endorse a candidate to replace Sen. Mitch McConnell as the Senate Republican leader.

item.title: Trump tariffs — and possible exemptions — could provide opportunities for Britain
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's proposed trade tariffs could prove boon for the U.K., with analysts pointing to potential exemptions, economic upswings and the likely resumption of trade deal talks.

item.title: Personal luxury goods market to shrink for first time since the 2008 financial crash, research finds
item.description: The personal luxury goods market looks set to face its first slowdown since the Global Financial Crisis, excluding the Covid period, a new report showed Wednesday.

item.title: Annual inflation rate hit 2.6% in October, meeting expectations
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.2% in October and show a 2.6% 12-month rate.

item.title: Business leaders weigh the U.S.' role in climate policy as Trump transitions to White House
item.description: Business leaders at the U.N. climate conference weighed the outlook for U.S. climate policy, as Washington transitions to Donald Trump's second term.

item.title: Liberty Media to spin off assets; CEO Greg Maffei to step down at year-end
item.description: Chairman John Malone will become interim CEO of Liberty Media. Liberty Media's investor day is set to take place on Thursday in Manhattan.

item.title: Denmark launches landmark framework for using AI under EU rules — with Microsoft backing
item.description: Denmark unveiled a blueprint on how to use generative AI in the corporate world to help firms get into compliance with strict new regulation from the EU.

item.title: China is catching up with the West on tech, Microsoft president says
item.description: According to Microsoft's web page about its presence in China, the company has operated there since 1992.

item.title: Mortgage demand stalls as financial markets digest Trump presidency
item.description: While tiny, the week's increase in total application volume marked the first rise in overall demand in seven weeks.
